CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It is well - known that balanced electron and hole mobility of the active layer is required for high performance polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

1. Balanced electron and hole mobility: This refers to the mobility of electrons and holes in the active layer of a polymer solar cell. The mobility is a measure of how easily charge carriers (electrons and holes) move through a material under an applied electric field.

Therefore, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are:

1. Active layer: This is the layer in a polymer solar cell where the photovoltaic effect occurs, i.e., where the electrons and holes are generated upon absorption of light. The active layer is typically made of a conjugated polymer or a blend of polymers and fullerene derivatives.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
Active layer (conjugated polymer or blend of polymers and fullerene derivatives)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Active layer (conjugated polymer or blend of polymers and fullerene derivatives) |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It is well - known that balanced electron and hole mobility of the active layer is required for high performance polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

1. Balanced electron and hole mobility: This refers to the ability of electrons and holes (charge carriers) to move freely and quickly within the active layer of a polymer solar cell. The term "mobility" describes the measure of how easily charge carriers can move through a material under an applied electric field. In this context, "electron mobility" and "hole mobility" are the properties being referred to.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Electron mobility |
| Hole mobility |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It is well - known that balanced electron and hole mobility of the active layer is required for high performance polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

1. Balanced electron and hole mobility: This is a compound property value, as it refers to the mobility of both electrons and holes in the active layer of polymer solar cells.

Mobility (electron): The mobility of electrons in the active layer of polymer solar cells.

Mobility (hole): The mobility of holes in the active layer of polymer solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Balanced electron mobility: The mobility of electrons in the active layer of polymer solar cells.
2. Hole mobility: The mobility of holes in the active layer of polymer solar cells.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Balanced electron mobility of the active layer |
| Mobility of electrons in the active layer of polymer solar cells |
| Mobility of holes in the active layer of polymer solar cells |
